content.description: The crux is actually the first 2 moves, as you can either attempt a layback, stay on the very slick face with your feet, or try to stay inside the crack all-together. Follow the crack until it ends, and face climb to the 2 rappel bolts.
content.protection: You'll need cams up the 4" for the crack, and the face isn't very exposed.
content.location: Left of the center of the wall

content.description: This is a fun short route from people wanting to learn how to lead, or for practice on sport routes. The crux is right between the 1st and 2nd bolt, 15' up. The only bad thing is that loose gravel on top where the rappel bolts are. At the 4th bolt you can either stay in the crack going to the right, or traverse over to the face right under the rappel bolts. The crack is a bit harder, but a lot of fun.
content.protection: Quickdraws needed for 4 bolts. 2 top bolts with rappel rings.
content.location: The route is on the right side of the wall.

climbs.name: Beginner Route
climbs.fa: Rob Knox, Mickey Dunagan & Mark Z

content.description: The crux is at the beginning, right before the first bolt. The route is just to the right on the center of the wall, left of "You Lead, I Follow". It's a fun route, with little holds at the crux. There's loose gravel on the top.
content.protection: You'll need quickdraws for the 4 bolts, and there's 2 top bolts with rappel rings on top.
content.location: Right of the center of the wall, and just left of "You Lead, I Follow"

content.description: This climb is on the right side of the gym area. A long vertical crack just left of the arete.
content.protection: A full set of cams and nuts. A few larger cams 4"+ are very helpful. There's 2 rappel bolts on the left that can be reached, but are pretty exposed, or you can rap down with the bolts to the right, which are the rap bolts for Living Sacrifice (a 5.12 route that nobody has topped out).
content.location: To the right of The Gym wall.
